page.title: 07INKBERROW,WORCESTERSHIRE.
page.content: {Inkberrow} is a village in Worcestershire.It is surrounded by farmland and there are several farms.The A422 divides the residential area into two parts.Old buildings mingle with new estates,where people have come to live in order to commute to work in the nearby towns.There aren't many shops,only the Post Office,Forge shop,Bakery and the garage.Major shopping is done in Redditch,Worcester,and Studley. There is one First School where most of the children go.The church is Saint Peter's.There are two pubs,the Old Bull and the Bull's Head.A telephone exchange is situated in Pepper Street. Villagers use the village hall regularly for leisure,clubs and some community services.
